list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment:
Simple Melee combat at last!
its come a long way, and it finally meets milestone 1, I can init a player, and some creatures, and they can try to kill eachother.
renamed the file character_classes to character_sheet
character_sheet: - moved init_wulfgar function to the end, so its out of the way - pushed the Equipment class out to its own file - pushed the events class out to its own file - fixed the

task.summary: character_classes.py renamed weaponry.attackDie to attack_die renamed CharacterSheet.__repr__ to full_str implemented characterSheet.melee_attack(self) - runs over equipped weapons, returns a dict with: - num: the number of attacks the character makes - effects: the effects to be applied to the attacked target - calculation: a damage function for the weapon: - this is to include character/class/race relevant bonus - weapons: the weaponry involved: - conveys the damage effects, and weapon attack function soon to make a similar variant for creature, given its somewhat more limited complexity wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block creatures.py: nothing important, just killed some whitespace encounter.py: further work towards implementing do_battle() enums.py: changed DAMAGETYPE subclasses to take arguments - can now instantiate self with given damage value a couple debug outs I haven't murdered yet. functions.py: dtypes no longer passed to GenericMelee.__init__() dtypes no longer a self value of GenericMelee.__init__() - contained within the weapon itself, or applied by its attack function, not needed here. misc.py: implemented a wrapper to call random as Die.random(self, upper) wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block weaponry.py: as mentioned in character_classes, renamed .attackDie to .attack_die renamed equipFuntion to equip_function

MESSAGE.value: character_classes.py renamed weaponry.attackDie to attack_die renamed CharacterSheet.__repr__ to full_str implemented characterSheet.melee_attack(self) - runs over equipped weapons, returns a dict with: - num: the number of attacks the character makes - effects: the effects to be applied to the attacked target - calculation: a damage function for the weapon: - this is to include character/class/race relevant bonus - weapons: the weaponry involved: - conveys the damage effects, and weapon attack function soon to make a similar variant for creature, given its somewhat more limited complexity wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block creatures.py: nothing important, just killed some whitespace encounter.py: further work towards implementing do_battle() enums.py: changed DAMAGETYPE subclasses to take arguments - can now instantiate self with given damage value a couple debug outs I haven't murdered yet. functions.py: dtypes no longer passed to GenericMelee.__init__() dtypes no longer a self value of GenericMelee.__init__() - contained within the weapon itself, or applied by its attack function, not needed here. misc.py: implemented a wrapper to call random as Die.random(self, upper) wrapped some testing/debug behind if name==main block weaponry.py: as mentioned in character_classes, renamed .attackDie to .attack_die renamed equipFuntion to equip_function
